message.404: Unfortunately, the requested page is not available.

meta.keywords: calendar, event, sharing, button, script, widget, rsvp, javascript, angular, react, vue, svelte, astro, web component, outlook, ical, microsoft, teams, apple, google, yahoo, free
meta.description: Experience the interactive demo and tutorials on how to create a button, which adds events to your users' calendars. Quick and convenient.
meta.seo-title: All about Add to Calendar Buttons

content.404RealContent: The real content can be accessed best via the home page.

home.intro_slogan_1: Let your users add events to their calendar
home.intro_block_1: Welcome to the maybe most conveniant way working with Add to Calendar Buttons.
home.intro_block_2: Designed to reduce developer headaches down to zero.
home.intro_block_3: Supporting all major calendars; in all modern browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari); on Windows, Mac, Android, and iOS as well as rather restricted webview environments like the Instagram in-app browser.
home.intro_block_4: Built as a Web Component, you can easily integrate it basically everywhere. Enjoy!
home.headline_installation: Bringing it to your web project
home.functionality_intro: Simple and convenient integration of 1 or many buttons, configurable directly within the HTML code!
home.demoDisclaimer: The playground only holds a subset of the available options. Check the "Configuration" page for more:

installation.intro_1: The script is built as a "Web Component".
installation.intro_2: This means that you can use it similar to any other HTML element and it is working out-of-the-box for all setups.
installation.intro_3: Find a step-by-step guide by selecting your environment.
installation.other_stack_2: The default setup is the way to go!

block_1.5: Automatically generated iCal/ics files (for all other calendars and cases).

block_2.4: Most robust time zone and daylight saving management (via our own TimeZones iCal Library).

block_4.1: Optimized and adjustable UX (for desktop and mobile).
block_4.3: Taking care of all those edge cases, where some scenarios do not support specific setups (like WebView blocking downloads); utilizing beautiful user guidance workarounds.
block_4.4: Full support for mouse, touch, or keyboard input (W3C WAI compliant).
block_4.5: Supporting 20+ languages, incl. RTL text for Arabic; but also custom labels and text blocks (i18n).

block_5.1: Auto-generated Schema.org rich (structured) data for better SEO.
block_5.2: Fully GDPR, CCPA, and LGPD compliant - without the need of signing some data processing agreement.

seo.features_headline_2: Those are some of the main features
seo.example: and here you can see how it looks like!
seo.example_disclaimer: But to be fair - this is just one out of so many configurable options!

legal.intro: Information in accordance with section 5 TMG and section 55 para. 2 RStV:

privacy.no-cookies-details-1: We are not using any cookies. We are also not following you around the web or sharing your data with any third party for marketing or tracking purposes.
privacy.no-cookies-details-2: Therefore, we do not need to bother you with a cookie banner.
privacy.no-cookies-details-3: The following information explains how we process data apart from this.
